channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Adelita Grijalva wins Arizona Democratic primary for late father's seat in Congress
item.description: Adelita Grijalva has won the Democratic nomination for a congressional district in Arizona held by her father, the late Rep. Raúl Grijalva, who held t...

item.title: In praise of the humble recorder — a gateway instrument for millions of schoolchildren
item.description: The small plastic instrument has long been the go-to instrument in elementary schools. But it is capable of so much more than "Hot Cross Buns."

item.title: Israel strikes in Damascus as Syrian forces clash with Druze groups
item.description: The strike came as clashes continued in the southern Syrian city of Sweida after a ceasefire between government forces and Druze armed groups collapse...

item.title: Even healthy brains decline with age. Here's what you can do
item.description: Scientists are finding ways to minimize the effects of aging on the brain. Here are some ways to keep it healthy.

item.title: Y'all, we need to talk about 'y'all'
item.description: The word fills an important gap in our language, but it was once stigmatized. The story of "y'all" also includes powerful cultural forces, from hip-ho...

item.title: US says it has deported five 'barbaric' migrants to Eswatini
item.description: The five people convicted of serious crimes come from Vietnam, Jamaica, Laos, Cuba and Yemen, the US says.

item.title: Man who murdered British backpacker Peter Falconio dies
item.description: Bradley Murdoch, who was serving a life sentence in prison, never disclosed the location of Peter Falconio's remains.

item.title: Trump says US attorney general should release any 'credible' information on Epstein
item.description: The president also said "only really bad people" want to stoke theories about the well-connected sex offender.

item.title: U.S. drug raids net $10 million in crypto linked to cartel, officials say
item.description: U.S. drug enforcement agents seized more than $10 million in cryptocurrency linked to Mexico's Sinaloa cartel during raids that also netted massive qu...

item.title: Thai woman arrested for blackmailing monks with thousands of videos after sex
item.description: The woman, known as "Ms Golf", allegedly had sexual relations with monks and extorted money from them.

item.title: States pass privacy laws to protect brain data collected by devices
item.description: Colorado, California, and Montana have passed neural data privacy laws meant to prevent the exploitation of brain information collected by consumer pr...

item.title: 7/15: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Attorney General Pam Bondi faces questions about handling of the Epstein files; Historic Washington, D.C., restaurant closing doors for renovations

item.title: Woman arrested for allegedly seducing, blackmailing Buddhist monks
item.description: At least nine abbots and senior monks involved in the scandal have been disrobed and cast out of the monkhood, police said.

item.title: Cuban minister resigns after saying country has no beggars
item.description: Marta Elena Feitó-Cabrera said people going through rubbish were doing so by choice to make "easy money".

item.title: 7/15: The Daily Report
item.description: Nancy Chen reports on new data surrounding inflation and Russia's response to President Trump's ultimatum to end the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Pam Bondi dodges questions on Epstein and Bongino amid Justice Department turmoil
Immigration agency flexes authority to sharply expand detention without bond hearing
item.description: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement is moving to detain far more people than before, tapping a legal authority to jail anyone who entered the cou...

item.title: Republicans press leaders of Georgetown, Berkeley and CUNY on antisemitism complaints
